name: cabinet
description:
Looking closer, you see the cabinet houses a complete industrial-capacity warp drive socket set.

This should most certainly contain the TOOL that Zhang briefed you on!
usedDescription: The cabinet door hangs open. There isn't anything else of use inside.

name: console
description:
The CONSOLE sits mostly darkened, with the exception of one obvious display.
It must be in some kind of power-savings mode.

name: pipes
fullName: a panel containing a section of the ship's Atmo-Ducts, maybe there's breathable air inside the PIPES
description:
Atmo-ducting. This heap isn't producing atmosphere anymore, but if you bleed the lines a bit with your suit you might be able to 
siphon off some nearby gases in them.
usedDescription: Atmo-ducting. You've siphoned off what you could from here, already.

name: ship
description:
The E.D.F.S. Spartan rests precariously on its twisted landing struts. Every few seconds her hull groans as Zhang shifts his weight inside. 
She's seen better days, but you're still breathing. 

You silently mouth words of appreciation.

name: rack
fullName: a ship parts RACK affixed with contraband components
description:
you spot several contraband parts originating from Praetor-class vessels affixed to a parts RACK.
This place is gonna be a mountain of paperwork...

Just when you're about to give up the search, you notice a compatible Engine COMPONENT for your ship!
usedDescription: the evidence teams are going to be here for weeks, but you have everything you need from here for now.

name: poster
fullName: a poster labeling the freighter ship's various sectors (THIS WOULD HAVE BEEN A PART OF THE REACTOR PUZZLE)
description:
Looking closer, you see the poster is actually a useful layout of the freighter, the sectors listed from bow to stern (North to South).
Unfortunately, the poster is now hanging UPSIDE DOWN.
The ship's various sectors are color coded, as well as described in text.

You examine the UPSIDE DOWN layout:(from the top)
Sector 6(Orange): Engine Room
Sector 5(Yellow): Reactor
Sector 4(Pink): Cargo
Sector 3(Green): Crew Quarters
Sector 2(Purple): Docking
Sector 1(Blue): Command
usedDescription:
You again examine the UPSIDE DOWN layout: (from the top)
Sector 6(Orange): Engine Room
Sector 5(Yellow): Reactor
Sector 4(Pink): Cargo
Sector 3(Green): Crew Quarters
Sector 2(Purple): Docking
Sector 1(Blue): Command

name: locker
fullName: a personal LOCKER for one of the original crew mates of this ship. Unlike the others, this one seems unlocked.
description: A personal LOCKER for one of the original crew mates of this ship. Unlike the others, this one seems unlocked.
usedDescription: Nothing else of use is inside.

name: cooler
description:
A Mortuary COOLER used to store corpses, slowing decomposition. Most of the doors are open, bloody remains hanging from them.
One still remains sealed...

(USE COOLER to open it)
usedDescription:
The Dead Captain's CORPSE lies bloated on the stretcher you pulled from the COOLER.
The smell is too much for you to push him back inside.
You feel guilty, from one Captain to another you apologize to the dead man.

name: airlock
fullName: a sealed AIRLOCK door (THIS WOULD HAVE BEEN A PUZZLE IN THE FINAL VERSION)
description: The AIRLOCK used for boarding parties to/from the Bridge. Its thick reinforced doors remain tightly SEALED.
usedDescription: Hopefully the vacuum actually kills the poor beast...

name: library
fullName: a small LIBRARY of what appear to be pamphlets
description: An emergency LIBRARY of physical training MANUALs needed for operating and repairing critical infrastructure within the ship.
usedDescription: You only need the MANUAL for your Engine COMPONENT. You can leave the rest here.
